critique: This executive order establishes a commission to advise the President on aviation safety and security. It is a fairly neutral document with little ideological content. The order does not directly address immigration, executive power, federalism, national security vs. civil liberties, economic regulation, or social inclusion in a way that would strongly indicate bias. The establishment of a commission could be seen as a slight expansion of executive power, but it is primarily an advisory role. The order also references the Federal Advisory Committee Act, indicating some constraint.
